FuncDef: The display cpu-defend http-hostcar statistics command displays statistics about packets controlled by HTTP-Host-CAR.
CLIs: display cpu-defend http-hostcar { <carid> | all | auto-adjust | dropped | non-dropped } statistics slot <slot-id>

ParaDef.Info:
Displays statistics about packets controlled by an HTTP-Host-CAR rule with a specified CAR ID.
The value is an integer in the range 0 to 4095.

Displays statistics about all packets controlled by HTTP-Host-CAR.
-

Displays the IDs of CAR rules in which the bandwidth values are automatically adjusted.
-

Displays statistics about packets in which some bytes are dropped.
-

Displays statistics in which the passed packet traffic is not 0 and the discarded packet traffic is 0.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If the CAR ID parameter is specified, the command displays statistics about the packets controlled by an HTTP-Host-CAR rule with a specified CAR ID. If the all parameters are specified, the command displays statistics about all packets.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
